steps.description: Guest reports a room issue via mobile app, website 'Help' widget, or front desk (e.g., cleanliness, maintenance, noise).
steps.businessRationale: Fast intake reduces guest frustration and prevents escalation; capturing structured data immediately enables faster routing and reduces potential revenue loss from cancellations.

steps.description: Automated acknowledgement sent; issue is triaged by on-site manager or central operations (severity, SLA, compensation policy).
steps.businessRationale: Correct triage ensures appropriate response level (housekeeping vs maintenance vs relocation); mis-triage increases operational cost and guest churn risk.

steps.description: Staff (housekeeping/maintenance) are dispatched; ETA and staff status tracked; guest receives ETA and optional room relocation if needed.
steps.businessRationale: Rapid on-site response reduces likelihood of guest abandoning stay or requesting refund; long dispatch times correlate with negative NPS and potential lost future revenue.

steps.description: Issue is resolved (cleaning, repair, room move) and compensation is offered if appropriate (voucher, partial refund, free breakfast). Compensation is recorded against the booking folio.
steps.businessRationale: Resolution plus fair compensation preserves customer lifetime value; compensation is a measurable cost but reduces churn and negative reviews which have larger long-term revenue impact.

steps.description: Post-resolution follow-up message and short survey sent to guest; guest can accept compensation or escalate to corporate support.
steps.businessRationale: Follow-up captures guest sentiment and prevents negative public reviews; positive follow-up increases retention probability and reduces acquisition cost for future bookings.

steps.description: Incident is logged in analytics, compensation cost reconciled with revenue, root-cause analysis triggered if thresholds exceeded, and SLA/operational metrics updated.
steps.businessRationale: Accurate reconciliation ensures correct accounting and identifies systemic issues; analytics drive process improvements that reduce future complaint rates and associated revenue leakage.
